etymology.description: 草 (grass; herb) + 莓 (berry) = herb/ground berry → strawberry
etymology.interpretation: Literally 'grass berry', highlighting a low-growing herbaceous plant that bears berries. Parallels other -莓 fruits and contrasts with 树莓 'tree berry' (raspberry), where 树 marks a woody plant.

parts.english: berry; small berry; strawberry (in compounds); bramble berry

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃草莓(我喜歡吃草莓)。
草莓很甜(草莓很甜)，适合做甜点(適合做甜點)。
examples.pinyin: Cǎoméi hěn tián, shìhé zuò tiándiǎn.
examples.english: Strawberries are sweet and good for making desserts.

examples.chinese: 她在市场买了一篮草莓(她在市場買了一籃草莓)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài shìchǎng mǎile yì lán cǎoméi.
examples.english: She bought a basket of strawberries at the market.
